alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Curry County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 2:20PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ROOSEVELT, NORTHEASTERN CHAVES AND SOUTHEASTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM MDT... At 219 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles west of Oasis State Park to near Kenna to 12 miles northeast of Bottomless Lakes State Park. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Portales, Elida, Dora, Floyd, Causey, Milnesand, Kenna, Lingo, Arch and Pep. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 168 and 200. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern and east central New Mexico.
